result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Hohner III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate accounts at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall have no contact with GKL or her family.

Defendant shall have no contact with any females under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.

Defendant shall have contact with his son only as approved by agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment, Sex Offender treatment, mental health assessment/treatment, or any other counseling, assessment and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by his agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall comply with Sex Offender Registry.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's mother and family are present.  PSI author and DOC supervisor are also present.  New PSI has now been filed;  report has been received/reviewed - no objections made to new report.  Defense also provided alternate sentencing report.  Court has reviewed letter from victim's mother.  Copies of original PSI have been collected; Court orders all copies of 1st report be sealed.  Victim's grandmother reads statement from victim's mother.  Argument from State and counsel.  Statement from def.  Court questions DOC supervisor.  Court identifies error in victm's DOB re Ct 2 in 2nd Amended Information; Court orders amendment and makes handwritten change.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court orders picture attached to victim impact statement sealed.

Letter received from H.L.; Please note that photo attached to this letter scanned separately and sealed with all copies of the Pre-Sentence Investigation Report submitted by The Department of Corrections on May 14, 2015 per Order Sealing Documents signed 6/24/15
Defense Sentencing Memorandum
Letter received from Atty. Nadya Perez-Reyes
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Presentence Investigation Corrections; Sealed
Letter sent by Judicial Assistant for Branch 4 to Department of Corrections
Sentencing hearing at 06-18-2015 03:00 pm
Sentencing hearing at 06-18-2015 03:00 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's family is present.  Matter was set for sentencing, however, counsel has now filed motion for new presentence report on behalf of def.  Court questions counsel and State; counsel puts objections to report on the record.  Argument from State and counsel.  Court will consider one image re Ct 5 offense that was dismissed and read-in and will attempt to redact PSI report so as to delete any reference as to any other images cited in the report.  Court will contact PSI author and inform of redaction; Court will require PSI author to respond in writing as to the one other image (or the two other images not considered pornography), whether she considered that image in making her recommendation and if told not to consider that image, if that would affect her recommendation.  Counsel/State to agree on what should be redacted and that all copies be redacted identically; they shall then inform PSI author of what needs to be redacted - copies may be collected by Court to seal in future.  Record of redaction to be made prior to proceeding to sentencing at next hearing.  Counsel req permission to file alternative PSI done by her office (client services); Court will so allow.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Fax cover sheet received from Atty Perez-Reyes
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel

Sealed; Please note that all copies of PSI submitted by the Department of Corrections scanned separately and sealed with photo attached to the letter filed on June 16, 2015 per Order Sealing Documents signed 6/24/15
$20,000 cash bond revoked; Defendant held without bond

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's family present.  Court reviews Amended Information & 2nd Amended Information w/def.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct 5; Court so orders.  On Ct 1 PSI recommended with both sides free to argue.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1 and orders presentence investigation report be completed.  Court revokes bond and remands def to jail pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim's family also present.  WITNESSES:  Lt. R. Lucka (WBPD).  Court finds State has met burden and binds def over.  State files and Court reviews Information w/def.  Evidence has been sent to State Crime Lab; State unsure of when that will be returned. Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya Perez-Reyes of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $20,000 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Clerk provides notice of hearing to def in 14CV563, TRO hearing on 8-15-14 at 2:30.  SPD unsure if they will be appointing counsel.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
